description: The Williamsburg Bridge is a suspension bridge across the East River, connecting the Lower East Side of Manhattan with the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn.
The Flatiron Building, originally the Fuller Building, is a 22-story, 285-foot-tall steel-framed triangular building at 175 Fifth Avenue in the Flatiron District neighborhood.
detail: End of an Era for the Flatiron Building

description: The Empire State Building is a 102-story Art Deco skyscraper in the Midtown South
detail: GREATEST SKYSCRAPER RISES ON A CLOCKWORK SCHEDULE

description: The Chrysler Building is an Art Deco skyscraper on the East Side at the intersection of 42nd Street and Lexington Avenue.
The New York Times Building is a 52-story skyscraper at 620 Eighth Avenue, between 40th and 41st Streets near Times Square.
detail: The Times Still Plans to Build An Office Tower in Midtown

description: 30 Rockfeller Plaza is a skyscraper that forms the centerpiece of Rockefeller Center in Midtown Manhattan.
The Seagram Building is a skyscraper at 375 Park Avenue, between 52nd and 53rd Streets, in the Midtown designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe.
detail: Seagram Building Marks Apex Of Mies van der Rohe's Career

description: The MetLife Building (formerly the Pan Am Building) is a skyscraper at Park Avenue and 45th Street, north of Grand Central Terminal.
detail: '200 Park Avenue' Preferred As Airline Heads South.

description: The Guggenheim is an art museum at 1071 Fifth Avenue between 88th and 89th Streets on the Upper East Side.
detail: The Guggenheim: Has a building ever inspired strong emotion in you?
